sca.name: Request -  Simple HTTP Client

vulnerabilities.description: Request contains a memory disclosure vulnerability due to issues in file `liv/multipart.js` with `multipart` attachments. A remote attacker is able to gain a specified number of non-zero memory due to it being disclosed within the body of the request.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-16026
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**2.68.0**](https://github.com/request/request/releases) by [this](https://github.com/request/request/commit/3d31d4526fa4d4e4f59b89cabe194fb671063cdb) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

vulnerabilities.description: Request package contains a vulnerability that can allow server side request forgery (SSRF) attacks using cross-protocol redirects. This could allow an attacker to use a malicious server in order to make requests on behalf of the application server and gather information about a victim's internal infrastructure. This vulnerability can be exploited even if there are anti-SSRF filtering measures in place.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-28155
vulnerabilities.title: Server-Side Request Forgery
vulnerabilities.workaround: A patch has been proposed [here](https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444/commits/d42332182512e56ba68446f49c3e3711e04301a2) that has not been merged with the upstream repository yet.

sca.name: on-headers

vulnerabilities.description:
On-Headers is vulnerable to HTTP response header manipulation due to incorrect handling of arrays. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using a crafted array in order to modify the values of HTTP response headers.

**Note:** This vulnerability only occurs when the `res.writeHead` function is used with On-Headers.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-7339
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.1.0**](https://github.com/jshttp/on-headers/releases/tag/v1.1.0) by [this](https://github.com/jshttp/on-headers/commit/c6e384908c9c6127d18831d16ab0bd96e1231867) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jshttp/on-headers/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has provided the following workaround [here](https://github.com/jshttp/on-headers/security/advisories/GHSA-76c9-3jph-rj3q):
> This issue can be worked around by passing an object to `response.writeHead()` rather than an array.

sca.name: einaros/ws

vulnerabilities.description: The Node.js `ws` module contains a flaw when handling headers containing the Object.prototype property. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header containing the vulnerable property name as an extension or parameter. If successful, a denial-of-service (*DoS*) will occur.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2017-3129
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in * **[3.3.1](https://github.com/websockets/ws/releases/tag/3.3.1)** by [this](https://github.com/websockets/ws/commit/c4fe46608acd61fbf7397eadc47378903f95b78a) commit.

sca.name: ms.js

vulnerabilities.description:
Vercel ms contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a system crash.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/vercel/ms/tags).

sca.name: Node Cookie Parser

vulnerabilities.description: cookie contains an input validation vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to inject values into the cookie `name` field which should not be allowed and may result in other fields of the cookie being escaped or containing unexpected values. This vulnerability also exists in the `path` and the `domain` field, allowing their values to alter the values of other cookie fields.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-47764
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**0.7.0**](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/releases/tag/v0.7.0) by [this](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/commit/e10042845354fea83bd8f34af72475eed1dadf5c) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Injection in Downstream Component
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has suggested the following workaround:
> Avoid passing untrusted or arbitrary values for these fields, ensure they are set by the application instead of user input.

sca.name: Request -  Simple HTTP Client

vulnerabilities.description: Request contains a memory disclosure vulnerability due to issues in file `liv/multipart.js` with `multipart` attachments. A remote attacker is able to gain a specified number of non-zero memory due to it being disclosed within the body of the request.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-16026
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**2.68.0**](https://github.com/request/request/releases) by [this](https://github.com/request/request/commit/3d31d4526fa4d4e4f59b89cabe194fb671063cdb) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

vulnerabilities.description: Request package contains a vulnerability that can allow server side request forgery (SSRF) attacks using cross-protocol redirects. This could allow an attacker to use a malicious server in order to make requests on behalf of the application server and gather information about a victim's internal infrastructure. This vulnerability can be exploited even if there are anti-SSRF filtering measures in place.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-28155
vulnerabilities.title: Server-Side Request Forgery
vulnerabilities.workaround: A patch has been proposed [here](https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444/commits/d42332182512e56ba68446f49c3e3711e04301a2) that has not been merged with the upstream repository yet.

sca.name: tar

vulnerabilities.description: The tar package for Node.js is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite and arbitrary code execution via insufficient absolute path sanitization.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-32804
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**3.2.2**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v3.2.2) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/147e078e5944bfd8d381bf19737e769e41705e4d) commit. 
* [**4.4.14**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.14) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/efc6bb0dbd54df8c7285d7aac12bba959b8387a6)commit. 
* [**5.0.6**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.6) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/69c56cb5aeb61941f5ab40dcbc7b47c181ec499a) commit. 
* [**6.1.1**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/1f036ca23f64a547bdd6c79c1a44bc62e8115da4) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation
vulnerabilities.workaround: Create a custom `onentry` method which sanitizes the entry.path or a filter method which removes entries with absolute paths.

vulnerabilities.description:
The node-tar package is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite issues due to a flaw in the symlink protection measures that allows for an untrusted tar file to symlink into an arbitrary location.

An attacker could poison the directory cache by first creating a directory and replacing it with a symlink with the same name. This allows the attacker to bypass symlink checks on directories and enable them to extract arbitrary files into potentially sensitive locations. The attacker could use this flaw to overwrite files to enable arbitrary code execution attacks.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-32803
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**3.2.3**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v3.2.3) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/85d3a942b4064e4ff171f91696fced7975167349) commit,
* [**4.4.15**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.15) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/46fe35083e2676e31c4e0a81639dce6da7aaa356) commit, 
* [**5.0.7**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.7) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/5987d9a41f6bfbf1ddab1098e1fdcf1a5618f571) commit, 
* [**6.1.2**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.2) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/9dbdeb6df8e9dbd96fa9e84341b9d74734be6c20) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation
vulnerabilities.workaround: It is suggested on [npmjs.com](https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1771#workarounds) that it is possible to mitigate the vulnerability by creating a custom `onentry` method which sanitizes the `entry.path` or a `filter` method which removes entries with absolute paths.

vulnerabilities.description: The tar package for Node.js is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite and arbitrary code execution via directory cache poisoning.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-37701
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.4.16**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.16) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/3f2e2da3866c4e5f26ca0c0d6721cb371c5a3933) commit. 
* [**5.0.8**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.8) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/ab3e9036dc4504413fb6f154ea6943af5c187e26)commit. 
* [**6.1.7**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.7) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/53602669f58ddbeb3294d7196b3320aaaed22728) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal

vulnerabilities.description: The tar package for Node.js is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite and arbitrary code execution via directory cache poisoning.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-37712
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.4.18**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.18) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/3f2e2da3866c4e5f26ca0c0d6721cb371c5a3933) commit and [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/bb93ba243746f705092905da1955ac3b0509ba1e).

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal

vulnerabilities.description:
The tar package for Node.js is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite via insufficient relative path sanitization. 

**Note:** This only affects users on Windows systems.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-37713
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.4.18**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.18) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/52b09e309bcae0c741a7eb79a17ef36e7828b946) commit. 
* [**5.0.10**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.10) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/82eac952f7c10765969ed464e549375854b26edc) commit.
* [**6.1.9**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.9) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/875a37e3ec031186fc6599f6807341f56c584598) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal

vulnerabilities.description: Node-Tar is vulnerable to path traversal due to insufficient link path sanitization in the 'unpack.ts' file when the `preservePaths` setting is set to false. A local attacker could exploit this issue by using a malicious TAR archive in order to overwrite the content of arbitrary files or achieve remote code execution (RCE) in CI/CD environments or automated pipelines, with the exception of NPM.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2026-23745
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**7.5.3**](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/releases/tag/v7.5.3) by [this](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/commit/340eb285b6d986e91969a1170d7fe9b0face405e) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal

vulnerabilities.description:
Node-Tar is vulnerable to a race condition due to improper handling of unicode path collisions in the `path-reservations.ts` file. A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit this issue by executing a symbolic link poisoning attack in order to overwrite the content of arbitrary files.

**Note:** This vulnerability only effects platforms which contain case-insensitive or normalization-insensitive filesystems such as macOS APFS.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2026-23950
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**7.5.4**](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/releases/tag/v7.5.4) by [this](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/commit/3b1abfae650056edfabcbe0a0df5954d390521e6) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Handling of Alternate Encoding
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has provided the following workaround [here](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/security/advisories/GHSA-r6q2-hw4h-h46w):
Users who cannot upgrade promptly, and who are programmatically using node-tar to extract arbitrary tarball data should filter out all `SymbolicLink` entries (as npm does) to defend against arbitrary file writes via this file system entry name collision issue.

vulnerabilities.description: node-tar is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite due to path traversal from the improper sanitization of hardlink paths during extraction. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this by supplying a crafted TAR archive, which could potentially bypass path traversal protections and create hardlinks to arbitrary files outside the extraction directory. Successful exploitation could allow for the overwriting of arbitrary files, unauthorized reading of sensitive files and credential stealing.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2026-24842
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**7.5.7**](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/releases/tag/v7.5.7) by [this](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/commit/f4a7aa9bc3d717c987fdf1480ff7a64e87ffdb46) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal

vulnerabilities.description: node-tar is vulnerable to the overwriting of files due to a lack of safety checks in its default extraction functionality. An attacker could overwrite files on the host filesystem by supplying a crafted tar file to an application that uses node-tar's unpack functionality.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2018-20834
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.4.2**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.2) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/b0c58433c22f5e7fe8b1c76373f27e3f81dcd4c8) commit.

Fixed in version [**2.2.2**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v2.2.2) by the following commits:
* [commit1](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/4f8585178af78f8f64c5ca38e923c306613278b9),
* [commit2](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/15e59f1d671ffbe4ae7c74dafcbec93ea2584e34),
* [commit3](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/9fc84b9c596c3589d4c1ab050843de0eafb002e8), and
* [commit4](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/7ecef07da6a9e72cc0c4d0c9c6a8e85b6b52395d).

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')

vulnerabilities.description: node-tar is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition due to missing limits on sub-folder creation during the folder creation process. An attacker could exploit this by generating a large number of sub-folder in order to consume memory on the system running node-tar and or to crash the Node.js client.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-28863
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**6.2.1**](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.2.1) by [this](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/commit/fe8cd57da5686f8695415414bda49206a545f7f7) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/isaacs/node-tar/releases).

sca.name: form-data

vulnerabilities.description: form-data generates random values using an pseudo random number generator (PRNG). If a remote attacker is able to view sequential values that are generated, they could predict future values which may allow them to modify HTTP request parameters.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-7783
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version:

* [**4.0.4**](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/releases/tag/v4.0.4) by [this](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/commit/3d1723080e6577a66f17f163ecd345a21d8d0fd0) commit.
* [**3.0.4**](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/releases/tag/v3.0.4) by [this](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/commit/c6ced61d4fae8f617ee2fd692133ed87baa5d0fd) commit.
* [**2.5.4**](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/releases/tag/v2.5.4) by [this](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/commit/b88316c94bb004323669cd3639dc8bb8262539eb) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/tags).

sca.name: markedjs

vulnerabilities.description: Marked is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (*XSS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This vulnerability can be used to execute JavaScript-based attacks.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2016-10531
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**0.3.6**](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/v0.3.6) by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/fd0d1a2935176c49918ec84d5cf13fcc25312fe9) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked).
vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting

vulnerabilities.description: marked contains a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. This allows an attacker to execute malicious JavaScript code in a victim's instance of marked, which could be used to steal session tokens, cookies, or other sensitive information.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-1000427
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**0.3.9**](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/0.3.9) by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/cd2f6f5b7091154c5526e79b5f3bfb4d15995a51) commit. 

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Script-Related HTML Tags in Web Pages

vulnerabilities.description: The Node.js marked module contains a flaw when handling regular expressions. The component uses a vulnerable regular expression when parsing markdown content which is vulnerable to exponential blowup. This could be exploited by an attacker to cause a slowdown and denial-of-service (*DoS*) condition. Requests will be delayed, but eventually processed.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-16114
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in version **[0.3.9](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/0.3.9)** by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/e5b2998326bd3911cff76f6b79e1aad9469e24fa) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression

vulnerabilities.description: Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) due to improper regex use when parsing HTML tags and markdown links. This could be exploited by an attacker by supplying an application with crafted markdown.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2018-25110
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in version [**0.3.18**](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/v0.3.18) by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/20bfc106013ed45713a21672ad4a34df94dcd485) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression

vulnerabilities.description: Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) due to a flaw present within a regular expression in the `src/rules.js` file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input in order to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-21681
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.0.10**](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/v4.0.10) by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/c4a3ccd344b6929afa8a1d50ac54a721e57012c0) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has proposed the following workaround:

> Do not run untrusted markdown through Marked or run Marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

vulnerabilities.description: Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) due to a flaw present within a regular expression in the `src/rules.js` file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input in order to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.

sca.name: hosted-git-info

vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23362

sca.name: Lodash

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or cause remote code execution or a denial-of-service (*DoS*).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-10744
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version **[4.17.12](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.12-npm)** with [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/793f983629f5ccef831360f4d31881bbf6264f8b) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://lodash.com/).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-3842
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-8203
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: lodash is vulnerable to a prototype pollution flaw. A remote attacker may be able to supply specially crafted input to cause serious confidentiality, integrity and availability impacts to the application. In the past, such vulnerabilities have lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the end application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-3839
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: lodash.set is vulnerable to prototype pollution. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-4901
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in lodash version [**4.17.16**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.16) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c84fe82760fb2d3e03a63379b297a1cc1a2fce12) commit.

**Note**: lodash.set is no longer maintained as its own exported Node.js module.
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23337
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/3469357cff396a26c363f8c1b5a91dde28ba4b1c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to functionality that allows users to influence protoypes. An attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by providing malicious input that modifies JavaScript prototypes within the application. It may also be possible for an attacker to modify data that exists within the application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-2147
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.19**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.19).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-28500
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c4847ebe7d14540bb28a8b932a9ce1b9ecbfee1a) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient validation of user provided paths in the `_.unset` and `_.omit` functions. This could allow a remote attacker to delete methods from global prototypes by using a maliciously crafted path.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that this issue does not allow for the behavior of properties to be overwritten, only deleted.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-13465
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.17.23**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23)
* [**4.17.23-amd**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-amd)
* [**4.17.23-es**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-es)
* [**4.17.23-npm**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-npm)

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Mass Assignment

vulnerabilities.description: The `package.json` file generated by node package manager for the lodash library contains out-dated information. The `contributors` section of the package.json file contains an URL that has been flagged for serving malware.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-0330
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/9ac205216ec7e097095856b971dea625f4da2fe6) commit in the npm branch. It is not yet part of any stable release.
vulnerabilities.title: Open URL Redirect

sca.name: gruntjs

vulnerabilities.description:
Grunt is vulnerable to an remote code execution (RCE) issue due to how the `load()` function is used by default to load YAML files.

An attacker could provide a crafted YAML file that, when loaded, could generate executable code and allow the attacker to run arbitrary code on the system.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7729
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**1.3.0**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.3.0) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/e350cea1724eb3476464561a380fb6a64e61e4e7) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: GruntJS contains a TOCTOU (Time of Check to Time of Use) race condition. An attacker with low-level privileges could exploit this issue by creating a symlink at a specific time. This may lead to the ability for an attacker to arbitrarily write files and potentially allow for local privilege escalation.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-1537
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.5.3**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.5.3) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/58016ffac5ed9338b63ecc2a63710f5027362bae) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition

vulnerabilities.description: grunt is vulnerable to a symlink following flaw that allows path traversal. If the application is run with high privileges this could allow a local attacker to read and write protected system files.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-0436
vulnerabilities.solution:

sca.name: javaselenium

vulnerabilities.description: Selenium Grid is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS) due to the insufficient sanitization of user input. This allows attackers to execute arbitrary web scripts in a victim's browser via a crafted payload. This could allow the attacker to steal information from a victim, such as browser cookies, or to manipulate the contents of the web page.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-23452
vulnerabilities.solution:
The vendor states [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/8259#issuecomment-632920668) that:
* Grid **3.x** is deprecated and not under development anymore.
* Grid **4** will have a different UI.
vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting

vulnerabilities.description: Selenium contains a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. An unprivileged attacker could exploit this by using the config file to set a custom handler. This may lead to the execution of remote code.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2021-4248
vulnerabilities.solution:
The Selenium `Grid4` Documentation has been updated [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/seleniumhq.github.io/commit/ef4a424c3a6a52b94f62b397baf84f7707ca6160) which warns users about not leaving a Grid exposed. 

A recommendation has also been included [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/9526) to use `basic auth` to help mitigate the risk and protect Grids. The following commits introduce and reference this functionality in Selenium version [**4.0.0-rc-1**](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/releases/tag/selenium-4.0.0-rc-1):
* [Commit 1](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/63fd7f722d36dd4942a574c8569a4b2ec4849e2f).
* [Commit 2](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/53ad48fbf4349413356d5a9a9589288ca6ed1d7a).
* [Commit 3](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/39b35f886ffdad505e29ae9ec6082c706a735d85).
* [Commit 4](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/2c437713b336ca516aca2666da672500fb862c36).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: Selenium is vulnerable to memory corruption due to the presence of a NULL pointer dereference issue. A remote attacker could exploit this under specific circumstances to corrupt memory and potentially leverage this to cause further serious confidentiality, integrity, and availability impacts.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-5590
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.14.0**](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/releases/tag/selenium-4.14.0) by [this](https://github.com/seleniumhq/selenium/commit/023a0d52f106321838ab1c0997e76693f4dcbdf6) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://www.selenium.dev/downloads/).

sca.name: shelljs

vulnerabilities.description:
ShellJS is vulnerable to privilege escalation and denial-of-service (DoS) issues due to how file permissions used by the internal implementation of `shell.exec()` are mishandled.

If ShellJS scripts running locally are using the ShellJS `exec()` function, an attacker with low-level privileges on the system could abuse the flaw in order to leak sensitive information, such as passwords, in order to perform local privilege escalation or shutdown privileged ShellJS processes.

A vendor comment [here](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/issues/1058#issuecomment-1008657537) indicates that this issue only impacts the `synchronous` version of `shell.exec()`. All other ShellJS methods (including the `async` usage of `shell.exec()`) should not be impacted.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-0144
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**0.8.5**](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/releases/tag/v0.8.5) by [this](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/commit/d919d22dd6de385edaa9d90313075a77f74b338c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/shelljs).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Privilege Management

vulnerabilities.description:
ShellJS is vulnerable to information disclosure due to the unsafe handling of the `stdout` and `stderr` streams of the `shell.exec()` function. A local attacker could potentially obtain sensitive data that has been produced by processes by examining the `stdout` file that is produced by ShellJS. This vulnerability can also be leveraged to crash privileged ShellJS processes.

It should be noted that only the synchronous version of `shell.exec()` function is affected by this issue.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2022-0115
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**0.8.5**](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/releases/tag/v0.8.5) by [this](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/commit/d919d22dd6de385edaa9d90313075a77f74b338c) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Sensitive Data Exposure

sca.name: Node Cookie Parser

vulnerabilities.description: cookie contains an input validation vulnerability. This could allow an attacker to inject values into the cookie `name` field which should not be allowed and may result in other fields of the cookie being escaped or containing unexpected values. This vulnerability also exists in the `path` and the `domain` field, allowing their values to alter the values of other cookie fields.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-47764
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**0.7.0**](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/releases/tag/v0.7.0) by [this](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/commit/e10042845354fea83bd8f34af72475eed1dadf5c) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jshttp/cookie/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Injection in Downstream Component
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has suggested the following workaround:
> Avoid passing untrusted or arbitrary values for these fields, ensure they are set by the application instead of user input.

sca.name: minimist

vulnerabilities.description:
minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7598
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.2.6**](https://github.com/substack/minimist/releases/tag/1.2.6) by [this](https://github.com/substack/minimist/commit/c2b981977fa834b223b408cfb860f933c9811e4d) commit. 

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/substack/minimist/tags)
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description:
Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-44906
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.2.6**](https://github.com/substack/minimist/releases/tag/1.2.6) by [this](https://github.com/substack/minimist/commit/c2b981977fa834b223b408cfb860f933c9811e4d) commit. 

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/substack/minimist/tags)

sca.name: qs -  QS Querystring

vulnerabilities.description: qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (*DoS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an attacker to render services unavailable or potentially craft other attacks.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-1000048
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/760d0a13912f788893b55d8f295dd47520b9d397) commit and [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/1c045cac47718c1c18c08df770ca0451e66e4e62) commit in:
* **[6.4.0](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.4.0)**
* **[6.3.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.3.2)**
* **[6.2.3](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.2.3)**
* **[6.1.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.1.2)**
* **[6.0.4](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.0.4)**

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases).

Note: initially the vendor partially fixed this issue with [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/beade029171b8cef9cee0d03ebe577e2dd84976d) commit, before it was discovered that this still allowed an attacker to exploit the issue using a prefixed `[` character, thus the above further commits were required.
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description: qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-24999
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**6.10.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.10.3) by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/8b4cc14cda94a5c89341b77e5fe435ec6c41be2d) commit.

The fix was backported by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/e799ba5) commit in:
* [**6.2.4**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.2.4)
* [**6.3.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.3.3)
* [**6.4.1**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.4.1)
* [**6.5.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.5.3)
* [**6.6.1**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.6.1)
* [**6.7.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.7.3)
* [**6.8.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.8.3)
* [**6.9.7**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.9.7)


The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type

vulnerabilities.description: QS is vulnerable to resource exhaustion due to improper input validation in the `parse.js` file when the `arrayLimit ` option is used for protection. A remote attacker could exploit this issue in order to bypass array limitations and exhaust system memory, which may impact the performance of the application or create a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**6.14.1**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.14.1) by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/3086902ecf7f088d0d1803887643ac6c03d415b9) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/yargs/y18n/releases/).

sca.name: minimist

vulnerabilities.description:
minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7598
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.2.6**](https://github.com/substack/minimist/releases/tag/1.2.6) by [this](https://github.com/substack/minimist/commit/c2b981977fa834b223b408cfb860f933c9811e4d) commit. 

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/substack/minimist/tags)
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description:
Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-44906
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.2.6**](https://github.com/substack/minimist/releases/tag/1.2.6) by [this](https://github.com/substack/minimist/commit/c2b981977fa834b223b408cfb860f933c9811e4d) commit. 

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/substack/minimist/tags)
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

sca.name: ansi-regex

vulnerabilities.description:
ansi-regex is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how certain crafted ANSI escaped codes are mishandled.

An attacker could submit a crafted string that, when matched, could cause excessive consumption of system resources that will impact stability and potentially cause a crash.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-3807
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in versions:
* [**6.0.1**](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/releases/tag/v6.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/commit/8d1d7cdb586269882c4bdc1b7325d0c58c8f76f9) commit. 
* [**5.0.1**](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/releases/tag/v5.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/commit/c3c0b3f2736b9c01feec0fef33980c43720dcde8) commit.
* [**4.1.1**](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/releases/tag/v4.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/commit/75a657da7af875b2e2724fd6331bf0a4b23d3c9a) commit.
* [**3.0.1**](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/releases/tag/v3.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/chalk/ansi-regex/commit/419250fa510bf31b4cc672e76537a64f9332e1f1) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/ansi-regex).

vulnerabilities.description: The MongoDB driver for Node.js is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper exception handling. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying an application with maliciously crafted data.

vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in version [**3.1.13**](https://github.com/mongodb/node-mongodb-native/releases/tag/v3.1.13) by [this](https://github.com/mongodb/node-mongodb-native/commit/210c71dccd8d8fdeadd9b4d1571e5fdb93e0f02f) commit.

sca.name: inflight

vulnerabilities.description:
A memory leak issue has been detected in Inflight. A local attacker could exploit this in order to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition via a crash of the node process or an application crash. 

**Note:** The Inflight project has not been updated for some time and may no longer be maintained.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2017-4131
vulnerabilities.title: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime
vulnerabilities.workaround:
Currently there is no official fix for this issue, however, some users have discussed potential workarounds in the [vulnerability thread](https://github.com/isaacs/inflight/issues/5):

It may be possible to define specific package overrides to force the use of packages that do not depend on Inflight. Such an approach depends on the availability of packages that have removed the Inflight dependency.

sca.name: qs -  QS Querystring

vulnerabilities.description: qs Module is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) triggered by excessive recursion in parsing a deeply nested JSON string. An attacker can submit a specially crafted string to crash the module.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2014-10064
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**1.0.0**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v1.0.0).
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion

vulnerabilities.description: Node.js module `qs` is vulnerable to a denial-of-service.  An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by suppling`qs` with a crafted string that deserializes into very large sparse arrays, resulting in the process running out of memory and eventually crashing.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2014-7191
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**1.0.0**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v1.0.0).

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description: qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (*DoS*) due to improper validation of user-supplied input. This could allow an attacker to render services unavailable or potentially craft other attacks.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-1000048
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/760d0a13912f788893b55d8f295dd47520b9d397) commit and [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/1c045cac47718c1c18c08df770ca0451e66e4e62) commit in:
* **[6.4.0](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.4.0)**
* **[6.3.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.3.2)**
* **[6.2.3](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.2.3)**
* **[6.1.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.1.2)**
* **[6.0.4](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.0.4)**

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases).

Note: initially the vendor partially fixed this issue with [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/beade029171b8cef9cee0d03ebe577e2dd84976d) commit, before it was discovered that this still allowed an attacker to exploit the issue using a prefixed `[` character, thus the above further commits were required.
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description: qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-24999
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**6.10.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.10.3) by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/8b4cc14cda94a5c89341b77e5fe435ec6c41be2d) commit.

The fix was backported by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/e799ba5) commit in:
* [**6.2.4**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.2.4)
* [**6.3.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.3.3)
* [**6.4.1**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.4.1)
* [**6.5.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.5.3)
* [**6.6.1**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.6.1)
* [**6.7.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.7.3)
* [**6.8.3**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.8.3)
* [**6.9.7**](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.9.7)


The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Handling of Unexpected Data Type

vulnerabilities.description: QS is vulnerable to resource exhaustion due to improper input validation in the `parse.js` file when the `arrayLimit ` option is used for protection. A remote attacker could exploit this issue in order to bypass array limitations and exhaust system memory, which may impact the performance of the application or create a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

vulnerabilities.description: form-data generates random values using an pseudo random number generator (PRNG). If a remote attacker is able to view sequential values that are generated, they could predict future values which may allow them to modify HTTP request parameters.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-7783
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version:

* [**4.0.4**](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/releases/tag/v4.0.4) by [this](https://github.com/form-data/form-data/commit/3d1723080e6577a66f17f163ecd345a21d8d0fd0) commit.

sca.name: fsevents

vulnerabilities.description:
fsevents npm package is vulnerable to hijacking due to malicious code run during installation via a hijacked URL in the install configuration. This would allow the current owner of the URL to run code of their choosing on each installation of the package.

**Note:** Originally, the credentials to the S3 bucket of the affected URL were [lost](https://github.com/fsevents/fsevents/releases/tag/v1.2.11). It was demonstrated by a security researcher that the bucket became available to register once again, and it was taken over by the researcher to demonstrate possible impact of this vulnerability. At this time, AWS has taken possession of the S3 bucket and currently blocks all access, neutralizing any threat. Should this bucket become available to use in the future, affected versions of fsevents will once again become vulnerable. This occurred in August 2023, when the bucket was briefly reinstated in error.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-45311
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.2.11**](https://github.com/fsevents/fsevents/releases/tag/v1.2.11) by [this](https://github.com/fsevents/fsevents/commit/909af26846834642c81d19f4148afa3b7557b058) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/fsevents/fsevents/releases/).

sca.name: js-yaml

vulnerabilities.description: js-yaml is vulnerable to code injection due to incorrect parsing of YAML documents. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted YAML file to a vulnerable application using js-yaml and the unsafe `load()` function to parse YAML data.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-2158
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**3.13.1**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.13.1) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/b2f9e882397660da37c5c5bb92e8ccc7bb9eb668) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description:
js-yaml is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `storeMappingPair` functionality.

An attacker could supply a crafted YAML document that includes `__proto__` nodes designed to modify prototypes of the resulting parsed document. In applications that parse untrusted YAML data, this issue could lead to unexpected behavior or potentially the execution of arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-64718
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.1.1**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/4.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/a00312147f287a1703bf6b7e104d27c8a0caacee) commit and [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/383665ff4248ec2192d1274e934462bb30426879) commit, and in [**3.14.2**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.14.2) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/5278870a17454fe8621dbd8c445c412529525266) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has supplied the following workaround advice in their official [advisory](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/security/advisories/GHSA-mh29-5h37-fv8m):
> You can protect against this kind of attack on the server by using `node --disable-proto=delete` or `deno` (in Deno, pollution protection is on by default).

vulnerabilities.description: js-yaml is vulnerable to an excessive resource consumption flaw. A remote attacker able to supply a specially crafted YAML file to an application using js-yaml could cause a denial-of-service (DoS).
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-4495
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**3.13.0**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.13.0) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/a567ef3c6e61eb319f0bfc2671d91061afb01235) commit.

sca.name: UglifyJS

vulnerabilities.description:
The uglify-js package is vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to CPU consumption when parsing a certain types of input. This can cause an application running the uglify-js package to hang by blocking the event loop. 

An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by supplying crafted input to the `parse()` function call.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2015-8858
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**2.6.0**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/uglify-js).

Fixed under Debian package via experimental repository in version [**3.3.10-1**](https://wiki.debian.org/DebianExperimental).

Note: Experimental is a staging/collaboration/experimental area for development and is not fit for production.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

sca.name: npm ini

vulnerabilities.description: The ini package is vulnerable to prototype pollution attacks.  A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. The impact of this vulnerability is reliant on the ini package parsing a untrusted input.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7788
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**1.3.6**](https://github.com/npm/ini/releases/tag/v1.3.6) by [this](https://github.com/npm/ini/commit/56d2805e07ccd94e2ba0984ac9240ff02d44b6f1) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/ini/releases).

sca.name: gruntjs

vulnerabilities.description:
Grunt is vulnerable to an remote code execution (RCE) issue due to how the `load()` function is used by default to load YAML files.

An attacker could provide a crafted YAML file that, when loaded, could generate executable code and allow the attacker to run arbitrary code on the system.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7729
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**1.3.0**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.3.0) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/e350cea1724eb3476464561a380fb6a64e61e4e7) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: GruntJS contains a TOCTOU (Time of Check to Time of Use) race condition. An attacker with low-level privileges could exploit this issue by creating a symlink at a specific time. This may lead to the ability for an attacker to arbitrarily write files and potentially allow for local privilege escalation.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-1537
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.5.3**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.5.3) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/58016ffac5ed9338b63ecc2a63710f5027362bae) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition

vulnerabilities.description: grunt is vulnerable to a symlink following flaw that allows path traversal. If the application is run with high privileges this could allow a local attacker to read and write protected system files.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-0436
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.5.0**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.5.0) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/aad3d4521c3098fb255fb2db8f2e1d691a033665) commit.

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/tags).

sca.name: micromatch/braces

vulnerabilities.description: The braces NPM package is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) via memory exhaustion due to lack of any restriction on the number of input characters it processes. An application that uses the library and accepts remote user input may be susceptible to the attack via a payload containing a large number of "imbalanced braces", `{` characters.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-4068
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**3.0.3**](https://github.com/micromatch/braces/releases/tag/3.0.3) by [this](https://github.com/micromatch/braces/commit/415d660c3002d1ab7e63dbf490c9851da80596ff) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/braces).

sca.name: Lodash

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or cause remote code execution or a denial-of-service (*DoS*).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-10744
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version **[4.17.12](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.12-npm)** with [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/793f983629f5ccef831360f4d31881bbf6264f8b) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://lodash.com/).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-3842
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-8203
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: lodash is vulnerable to a prototype pollution flaw. A remote attacker may be able to supply specially crafted input to cause serious confidentiality, integrity and availability impacts to the application. In the past, such vulnerabilities have lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the end application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-3839
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: lodash.set is vulnerable to prototype pollution. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-4901
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in lodash version [**4.17.16**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.16) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c84fe82760fb2d3e03a63379b297a1cc1a2fce12) commit.

**Note**: lodash.set is no longer maintained as its own exported Node.js module.
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23337
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/3469357cff396a26c363f8c1b5a91dde28ba4b1c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to functionality that allows users to influence protoypes. An attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by providing malicious input that modifies JavaScript prototypes within the application. It may also be possible for an attacker to modify data that exists within the application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-2147
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.19**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.19).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-28500
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c4847ebe7d14540bb28a8b932a9ce1b9ecbfee1a) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient validation of user provided paths in the `_.unset` and `_.omit` functions. This could allow a remote attacker to delete methods from global prototypes by using a maliciously crafted path.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that this issue does not allow for the behavior of properties to be overwritten, only deleted.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-13465
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.17.23**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23)
* [**4.17.23-amd**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-amd)
* [**4.17.23-es**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-es)
* [**4.17.23-npm**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-npm)

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Mass Assignment

vulnerabilities.description: The `package.json` file generated by node package manager for the lodash library contains out-dated information. The `contributors` section of the package.json file contains an URL that has been flagged for serving malware.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-0330
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/9ac205216ec7e097095856b971dea625f4da2fe6) commit in the npm branch. It is not yet part of any stable release.

sca.name: tough-cookie

vulnerabilities.description: tough-cookie is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to improper handling of cookies when using `CookieJar` in `rejectPublicSuffixes=false` mode.  An attacker can use this vulnerability to override the global object prototype in order to cause unspecified impacts.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-26136
vulnerabilities.solution:

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/salesforce/tough-cookie/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Mass Assignment

vulnerabilities.description: By supplying a large HTTP request cookie header to an application using the Tough-Cookie Node.js an attacker could cause the application to consume an excessive amount of CPU.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-15010

sca.name: set-value

vulnerabilities.description:
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-10747
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/4.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/383b72d47c74a55ae8b6e231da548f9280a4296a) commit.

Fixed in [**2.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/2.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/cb12f14955dde6e61829d70d1851bfea6a3c31ad) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description: set-value is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack due to a type confusion error which can lead to a bypass of **CVE-2019-10747** (**BDSA-2019-4362**). A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23440
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/4.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/383b72d47c74a55ae8b6e231da548f9280a4296a) commit.

Fixed in [**2.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/2.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/cb12f14955dde6e61829d70d1851bfea6a3c31ad) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases).

sca.name: jsdiff

vulnerabilities.description: jsdiff is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) and regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) due to improper handling of specific line break characters (`\r`, `\u2028`, `\u2029`) in the `parsePatch` and `applyPatch` methods. This could allow an attacker to cause an infinite loop leading to memory exhaustion or exploit inefficient regular expression parsing to consume excessive CPU resources.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2026-0611
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**8.0.3**](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/releases/tag/v8.0.3) by [this](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/commit/15a1585230748c8ae6f8274c202e0c87309142f5) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.workaround:
Per the Vendor, 

> If using a version of jsdiff earlier than v8.0.3, do not attempt to parse patches that contain any of these characters: `\r`, `\u2028`, or `\u2029`.

vulnerabilities.description: jsdiff is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to an infinite loop when parsing a patch with unexpected filename headers. An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit this by supplying crafted line break characters failing to match the expected regular expression. Successful exploitation could allow for an infinite loop potentially causing uncontrolled memory consumption which could lead to a crash in the application.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2026-24001
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.0.4**](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/releases/tag/v4.0.4) by [this](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/commit/4568cae5ae7646962bf3c5641907d1fb5af90683) commit, 
* [**5.2.1**](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/releases/tag/v5.2.1) by [this](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/commit/78017899c4c80d51db805b6e013079cadc6ed0ae) commit,
* [**8.0.3**](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/releases/tag/v8.0.3) by [this](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/commit/15a1585230748c8ae6f8274c202e0c87309142f5) commit.


The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression
vulnerabilities.workaround:
As per the vendor, 

> If using a version of jsdiff earlier than v8.0.3, do not attempt to parse patches that contain any of these characters: `\r`, `\u2028`, or `\u2029`.

sca.name: path-to-regexp

vulnerabilities.description:
Path-to-RegExp is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how it is possible for an inefficient expression to be generated for some routes that make use of named parameters.

The expression generated from affected routes is susceptible to excessive backtracking. An attacker could submit a crafted path input to a vulnerable application in order to trigger the backtracking flaw when attempts to match against the path are made. The inefficient matching operations could cause excessive consumption of CPU cycles and result in degraded performance for other clients.

**Note**: the original fix for **0.1.x** releases was discovered to be incomplete, which required a further fix disclosed under **CVE-2024-52798** (**BDSA-2024-9447**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-45296
vulnerabilities.solution:
The vendor has provided patches that offer varying degrees of protection against this regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue.

Firstly, the vendor has recommended that users of versions above the **0.1.x** release series should upgrade to version [**8.0.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v8.0.0) or above.
**Note**: This release contains a large breaking change in that it outright removes the regular expression override feature.

A "backtracking protection" mechanism was developed for older releases where a large breaking change was not feasible. The mechanism is active when a custom regex pattern is not provided. This change was made available in:
* [**6.3.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v6.3.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f1253b47b347dcb909e3e80b0eb2649109e59894) commit,
* [**3.3.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v3.3.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/d31670ae8f6e69cbfd56e835742195b7d10942ef) commit,
* [**1.9.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v1.9.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/925ac8e3c5780b02f58cbd4e52f95da8ad2ac485) commit,
* [**0.1.12**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v0.1.12) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f01c26a013b1889f0c217c643964513acf17f6a4) commit.

**Warning**: The "backtracking protection" mechanism does not protect against vulnerable user-supplied capture groups. The vendor considers protecting against explicit user-supplied patterns to be out of scope for old versions. The "backtracking protection" measures can also be considered a breaking change for some users.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.workaround:
Version [**7.1.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v7.1.0) offers a non-default `strict` option that can be enabled with `strict: true` in order to receive errors where a regular expression that may cause regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issues is detected. This feature is documented [here](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/blob/v7.1.0/Readme.md#developers).

Aside from the workaround provided in this release, the vendor has also provided the following workaround advice in their [advisory](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/security/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j) that can be applied manually:

> All versions can be patched by providing a custom regular expression for parameters after the first in a single segment. As long as the custom regular expression does not match the text before the parameter, you will be safe. For example, change `/:a-:b` to `/:a-:b([^-/]+)`.
> 
> If paths cannot be rewritten and versions cannot be upgraded, another alternative is to limit the URL length. For example, halving the attack string improves performance by 4x faster.

vulnerabilities.description:
Path-to-RegExp is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how it is possible for an inefficient expression to be generated for some routes that make use of named parameters.

The expression generated from affected routes is susceptible to excessive backtracking. An attacker could submit a crafted path input to a vulnerable application in order to trigger the backtracking flaw when attempts to match against the path are made. The inefficient matching operations could cause excessive consumption of CPU cycles and result in degraded performance for other clients.

**Note**: this issue exists due to the discovery of an incomplete fix made for **0.1.x** releases to address **CVE-2024-45296** (**BDSA-2024-6246**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-52798
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in version [**0.1.12**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v0.1.12) by [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f01c26a013b1889f0c217c643964513acf17f6a4) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has provided the following workaround advice in their [advisory](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/security/advisories/GHSA-rhx6-c78j-4q9w):

> Avoid using two parameters within a single path segment, when the separator is not . (e.g. no /:a-:b). Alternatively, you can define the regex used for both parameters and ensure they do not overlap to allow backtracking.

sca.name: Lodash

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23337
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/3469357cff396a26c363f8c1b5a91dde28ba4b1c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-28500
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c4847ebe7d14540bb28a8b932a9ce1b9ecbfee1a) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient validation of user provided paths in the `_.unset` and `_.omit` functions. This could allow a remote attacker to delete methods from global prototypes by using a maliciously crafted path.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that this issue does not allow for the behavior of properties to be overwritten, only deleted.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-13465
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.17.23**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23)
* [**4.17.23-amd**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-amd)
* [**4.17.23-es**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-es)
* [**4.17.23-npm**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-npm)

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Mass Assignment

sca.name: es5-ext

vulnerabilities.description: es5-ext contains ECMAScript 5 extensions. Passing functions with very long names or complex default argument names into `function#copy` or `function#toStringTokens` may cause the script to stall. The vulnerability is patched in v0.10.63.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2024-27088
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

sca.name: js-yaml

vulnerabilities.description: js-yaml is vulnerable to code injection due to incorrect parsing of YAML documents. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted YAML file to a vulnerable application using js-yaml and the unsafe `load()` function to parse YAML data.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-2158
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**3.13.1**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.13.1) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/b2f9e882397660da37c5c5bb92e8ccc7bb9eb668) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description:
js-yaml is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `storeMappingPair` functionality.

An attacker could supply a crafted YAML document that includes `__proto__` nodes designed to modify prototypes of the resulting parsed document. In applications that parse untrusted YAML data, this issue could lead to unexpected behavior or potentially the execution of arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-64718
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.1.1**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/4.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/a00312147f287a1703bf6b7e104d27c8a0caacee) commit and [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/383665ff4248ec2192d1274e934462bb30426879) commit, and in [**3.14.2**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.14.2) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/5278870a17454fe8621dbd8c445c412529525266) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has supplied the following workaround advice in their official [advisory](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/security/advisories/GHSA-mh29-5h37-fv8m):
> You can protect against this kind of attack on the server by using `node --disable-proto=delete` or `deno` (in Deno, pollution protection is on by default).

vulnerabilities.description: js-yaml is vulnerable to an excessive resource consumption flaw. A remote attacker able to supply a specially crafted YAML file to an application using js-yaml could cause a denial-of-service (DoS).
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-4495
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**3.13.0**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.13.0) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/a567ef3c6e61eb319f0bfc2671d91061afb01235) commit.

The latest releases are available [here](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/).
