sca.name: set-value

vulnerabilities.description:
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-10747
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/4.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/383b72d47c74a55ae8b6e231da548f9280a4296a) commit.

Fixed in [**2.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/2.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/cb12f14955dde6e61829d70d1851bfea6a3c31ad) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases).

sca.name: hueniverse/hawk

vulnerabilities.description: Hawk, a HTTP authentication scheme, is vulnerable to regular expression denial-of-service (*ReDoS*) due to its implementation of pattern matching.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2016-2515
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**3.1.3**](https://github.com/hueniverse/hawk/releases/tag/v3.1.3) by [this](https://github.com/hueniverse/hawk/commit/ccebde4b24d06014ac573888a21813b29a4a16c7) commit.
Fixed in [**4.1.1**](https://github.com/hueniverse/hawk/releases/tag/v4.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/hueniverse/hawk/commit/0833f99ba64558525995a7e21d4093da1f3e15fa) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression

vulnerabilities.description: Node.js Hawk contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a crash.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-29167
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**9.0.1**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hawk/v/9.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/mozilla/hawk/commit/d10d72ca82db967f6c5fcf866ff78e3ca25ce1ab) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hawk).
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
vulnerabilities.workaround:
The vendor has issued the following workaround:

"`Hawk.authenticate()` accepts the options argument. If that contains host and port, those would be used instead of a call to `utils.parseHost()`".

sca.name: gruntjs

vulnerabilities.description:
Grunt is vulnerable to an remote code execution (RCE) issue due to how the `load()` function is used by default to load YAML files.

An attacker could provide a crafted YAML file that, when loaded, could generate executable code and allow the attacker to run arbitrary code on the system.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-7729
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**1.3.0**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.3.0) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/e350cea1724eb3476464561a380fb6a64e61e4e7) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: GruntJS contains a TOCTOU (Time of Check to Time of Use) race condition. An attacker with low-level privileges could exploit this issue by creating a symlink at a specific time. This may lead to the ability for an attacker to arbitrarily write files and potentially allow for local privilege escalation.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-1537
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.5.3**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.5.3) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/58016ffac5ed9338b63ecc2a63710f5027362bae) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition

vulnerabilities.description: grunt is vulnerable to a symlink following flaw that allows path traversal. If the application is run with high privileges this could allow a local attacker to read and write protected system files.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-0436
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**1.5.0**](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/releases/tag/v1.5.0) by [this](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/commit/aad3d4521c3098fb255fb2db8f2e1d691a033665) commit.

The latest releases can be found [here](https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt/tags).

vulnerabilities.description: The debug module is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service when untrusted user input is passed into the o formatter. It takes around 50k characters to block for 2 seconds making this a low severity issue.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-16137

sca.name: Async

vulnerabilities.description: Async is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue. A remote attacker may be able to abuse this issue in order to execute arbitrary code, obtain privileges, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-43138
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**3.2.2**](https://github.com/caolan/async/releases/tag/v3.2.2) by [this](https://github.com/caolan/async/commit/e1ecdbf79264f9ab488c7799f4c76996d5dca66d) commit and in [**2.6.4**](https://github.com/caolan/async/releases/tag/v2.6.4) by [this](https://github.com/caolan/async/commit/8f7f90342a6571ba1c197d747ebed30c368096d2) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/caolan/async/tags).

sca.name: Request -  Simple HTTP Client

vulnerabilities.description: Request package contains a vulnerability that can allow server side request forgery (SSRF) attacks using cross-protocol redirects. This could allow an attacker to use a malicious server in order to make requests on behalf of the application server and gather information about a victim's internal infrastructure. This vulnerability can be exploited even if there are anti-SSRF filtering measures in place.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2023-28155
vulnerabilities.title: Server-Side Request Forgery
vulnerabilities.workaround: A patch has been proposed [here](https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444/commits/d42332182512e56ba68446f49c3e3711e04301a2) that has not been merged with the upstream repository yet.

sca.name: json-schema

vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-3918
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**0.4.0**](https://github.com/kriszyp/json-schema/releases/tag/v0.4.0) by [this](https://github.com/kriszyp/json-schema/commit/22f146111f541d9737e832823699ad3528ca7741) commit.

sca.name: debug-js/debug

vulnerabilities.description:
Debug-js is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service when malicious regular expression input is passed into the `%o` formatter. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying crafted input to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

**Note**: **CVE-2017-20165** (**BDSA-2017-4102**) is a duplicate disclosure of this issue.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-16137
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**2.6.9**](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/releases/tag/2.6.9) and [**3.1.0**](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/releases/tag/3.1.0) by [this](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/commit/f53962e944a87e6ca9bb622a2a12dffc22a9bb5a) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Regular Expression

vulnerabilities.description:
Debug-js is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service when malicious regular expression input is passed into the `%o` formatter. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw by supplying crafted input to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

**Note**: This issue is a duplicate disclosure of **CVE-2017-16137** (**BDSA-2017-3626**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2017-20165
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**2.6.9**](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/releases/tag/2.6.9) and [**3.1.0**](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/releases/tag/3.1.0) by [this](https://github.com/visionmedia/debug/commit/f53962e944a87e6ca9bb622a2a12dffc22a9bb5a) commit.

sca.name: indexzero/nconf

vulnerabilities.description: nconf is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation within the memory engine. This could allow an attacker to maliciously modify object prototypes, which depending on how objects are used by an application, could cause impacts such as denial-of-service (DoS), cross-site scripting (XSS) or remote code execution (RCE).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2022-21803
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**0.11.4**](https://github.com/indexzero/nconf/releases/tag/v0.11.4) by [this](https://github.com/indexzero/nconf/commit/feaba562b812b21215897f71b0c8b3bf39cf8d7d) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/indexzero/nconf/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

sca.name: stringstream

vulnerabilities.description: The stringstream package for Node.js is vulnerable to a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.  If an application is supplying untrusted user input to the `write` function, an attacker can trigger an out-of-bounds read that may result in uninitilzed memory being exposed of the application crashing.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2018-21270
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**0.0.6**](https://github.com/mhart/StringStream/releases/tag/v0.0.6) by [this](https://github.com/mhart/StringStream/commit/afbc7442220358419e330618e47f3a65fc265b1b) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

sca.name: Handlebars.js

vulnerabilities.description: It was discovered the Handlebars package is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution via prototype pollution. A remote attacker could exploit this to run malicious code by modifying properties of the Object prototype.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2018-4846
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in 

* [**4.0.14**](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.0.14) by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/85c8783b34fc6d36145d8b53885ad0b9e3c3f9c4) commit and [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/7372d4e9dffc9d70c09671aa28b9392a1577fd86) commit.
* [**4.1.2**](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.1.2) by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/cd38583216dce3252831916323202749431c773e) commit and [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/edc6220d51139b32c28e51641fadad59a543ae57) commit.
* [**3.0.7**](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v3.0.7) by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/0d6d8c335ad81bad1b672fc56b6a44f6aa472dac) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: The handlebars package for Node.js is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to improper restrictions on object access in templates which can lead to prototype pollution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying maliciously crafted input.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-19919
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in **[4.3.2](https://www.npmjs.com/package/handlebars/v/4.3.2)** by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/2078c727c627f25d4a149962f05c1e069beb18bc) commit and [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/213c0bbe3c4bd83a534d67384e5afa0000347ff6) commit, and **[3.0.8](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v3.0.8)** by [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/commit/156061eb7707575293613d7fdf90e2bdaac029ee) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: The handlebars package is vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) and remote code execution (RCE) attacks due to improper validation of user-supplied input. In a cross-site scripting scenario, an attacker could exploit this to pass malicious arbitrary JavaScript into template, which will execute when a victim visits the crafted page. If handlebars is used to run on the server side, remote code execution is possible.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-20920
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in **[4.5.3](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.5.3)** by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/1988878) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://handlebarsjs.com/installation/#downloading-handlebars).
vulnerabilities.title: Cross-site Scripting

vulnerabilities.description: The handlebars package is vulnerable to arbitrary code execution via prototype pollution. A remote attacker can run malicious code by modifying properties of the Object prototype. Unsuccessful attacks may result in an application crash.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-3692
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.5.3**](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.5.3) by [this](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/198887808780bbef9dba67a8af68ece091d5baa7#diff-6edec79e6a2a6e43a3e8c76145a88477) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description: handlebars.js, an extension to Mustache, contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. An attacker could exploit this issue by accessing prototype properties and methods, which may result in the attacker being able to force an application crash or gain the ability to execute arbitrary code.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-4765
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version [**4.6.0**](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.6.0) by [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/commit/d03b6ecfc44e350fd08df752a9551d824287d7f5) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Access Control

vulnerabilities.description: handlebars.js, an extension to the Mustache templating language, is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) when compiling templates that come from untrusted sources. Successful exploitation also requires certain compilation options to be used.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23369
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.7.7**](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.7.7) by [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/commit/f0589701698268578199be25285b2ebea1c1e427) and [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/commit/b6d3de7123eebba603e321f04afdbae608e8fea8) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage
vulnerabilities.workaround: A fix for the **3.x** branch is proposed in [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/pull/1751) pull request which has not yet been merged.

vulnerabilities.description: handlebars.js, an extension to the Mustache templating language, is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution when compiling templates that come from untrusted sources. Although successful exploitation could result in remote code execution (RCE), it also requires that a certain compilation option is used.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23383
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.7.7**](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases/tag/v4.7.7) by [this](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/commit/f0589701698268578199be25285b2ebea1c1e427) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: Handlebars before 4.4.5 allows Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) because of eager matching. The parser may be forced into an endless loop while processing crafted templates. This may allow attackers to exhaust system resources.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-20922
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

sca.componentURL: [Click Here To See More Details in Polaris](https://stg.dev.polaris.blackduck.com/portfolio/portfolios/5d4d6184-07f5-4fd1-a024-4345aace406c/portfolio-items/c44a936d-28dd-4bf6-9c10-9e6e51a86928/projects/6feceb14-1105-4721-93f7-9527ef56f17f/components/73face6e-1832-4284-b4bf-f9c12e593190?branchId=a746cffc-6c3b-48ff-b4c4-361525903fac&component=22d01dc5-8527-414e-af3d-6ad98108869e)
sca.name: Lodash

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a prototype pollution flaw. An attacker could exploit this to modify the component or cause remote code execution or a denial-of-service (*DoS*).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2019-10744
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in version **[4.17.12](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.12-npm)** with [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/793f983629f5ccef831360f4d31881bbf6264f8b) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://lodash.com/).
vulnerabilities.title: Weak Input Validation

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-3842
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-8203
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.
vulnerabilities.title: Third-party component usage

vulnerabilities.description: lodash is vulnerable to a prototype pollution flaw. A remote attacker may be able to supply specially crafted input to cause serious confidentiality, integrity and availability impacts to the application. In the past, such vulnerabilities have lead to remote code execution (RCE) in the end application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-3839
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in **[4.17.20](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.20)**.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: lodash.set is vulnerable to prototype pollution. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype`.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-4901
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in lodash version [**4.17.16**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.16) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c84fe82760fb2d3e03a63379b297a1cc1a2fce12) commit.

**Note**: lodash.set is no longer maintained as its own exported Node.js module.
vulnerabilities.title: Modification of Assumed-Immutable Data

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to command injection via the `template` function. An attacker can take advantage of this vulnerability in order to run arbitrary commands.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2021-23337
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/3469357cff396a26c363f8c1b5a91dde28ba4b1c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to functionality that allows users to influence protoypes. An attacker could cause a vulnerable application to crash by providing malicious input that modifies JavaScript prototypes within the application. It may also be possible for an attacker to modify data that exists within the application.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2020-2147
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.19**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.19).
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Control of a Resource Through its Lifetime

vulnerabilities.description: Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2020-28500
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed in [**4.17.21**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.21) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/c4847ebe7d14540bb28a8b932a9ce1b9ecbfee1a) commit.
vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

vulnerabilities.description:
Lodash is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient validation of user provided paths in the `_.unset` and `_.omit` functions. This could allow a remote attacker to delete methods from global prototypes by using a maliciously crafted path.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that this issue does not allow for the behavior of properties to be overwritten, only deleted.
vulnerabilities.name: CVE-2025-13465
vulnerabilities.solution:
Fixed in:
* [**4.17.23**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23)
* [**4.17.23-amd**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-amd)
* [**4.17.23-es**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-es)
* [**4.17.23-npm**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.23-npm)

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/tags).
vulnerabilities.title: Mass Assignment

vulnerabilities.description: The `package.json` file generated by node package manager for the lodash library contains out-dated information. The `contributors` section of the package.json file contains an URL that has been flagged for serving malware.
vulnerabilities.name: BDSA-2019-0330
vulnerabilities.solution: Fixed by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/9ac205216ec7e097095856b971dea625f4da2fe6) commit in the npm branch. It is not yet part of any stable release.
vulnerabilities.title: Open URL Redirect
